The collision between blocks a and b is perfectly elastic and head-on, with equal masses.
For a one-dimensional, perfectly elastic collision of two equal masses, the velocities are exchanged: v_a, after = v_b, before and v_b, after = v_a, before = 0.
Therefore, the speed acquired by block a immediately after the collision is v₀ = v_b, before = 5 m/s.
None of the other data—belt speed, track lengths, friction coefficients, radii, etc.—affect this instantaneous post-collision speed.
The magnitude of the velocity of block a immediately after its elastic collision with block b is v₀ = 5 m/s.
